isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR WIPER MOTOR (HEADER MOUNTED, DRIVER SIDE)

svcproc.title: AIR WIPER MOTOR (HEADER MOUNTED, DRIVER SIDE)

step1.para: Remove acorn nut, lockwasher and wiper arm and blade ( Items 5, 4, and 3, Figure 90). Refer to WIPER ARM, Remove, above.
Remove the serrated drive bushing, weather seal, hex lock nut, outer spacer, leather flat washer and inner spacer ( Items 6 thru 11, Figure 90) from the wiper motor shaft ( Item 12, Figure 90).
Remove the 6 mounting screws ( Item 4, Figure 91) from the cab header and lower the windshield wiper/washer control panel ( Item 7, Figure 91).

Disconnect the air lines ( Item 2, Figure 92) to the wiper control valves ( Items 3 and 8, Figure 92), then disconnect electrical connections ( Item 6, Figure 92) to the washer control switch ( Item 4, Figure 92) and indicator lights ( Item 2, Figure 91). Position the wiper/washer control panel ( Item 7, Figure 91) out of the way to remove the driver side wiper motor assembly ( Item 9, Figure 93).

Disconnect and remove the air supply lines ( Item 5, Figure 93) and exhaust valve air line ( Item 8, Figure 93) from the driver side wiper motor assembly ( Item 9, Figure 93). Note the routing of the air lines for installation.
Remove the 2 motor mounting bracket bolts ( Item 5, Figure 91) below the wiper/washer control panel opening, then remove the driver side motor assembly ( Item 9, Figure 93) from the vehicle.

note.para: Make sure the air motor is in the park position.

step1.para: If removed, fasten the motor mounting bracket to the wiper motor (with the bolts, lockwashers and nuts. Tighten to 40 to 62 in-lbs. (4.5 to 7 Nm).
Position the driver side wiper motor assembly in the header through the wiper/washer control panel opening.
Route air supply lines and exhaust valve air line and attach them to the driver side wiper motor assembly.

note.para: Make certain that the exhaust valve air line ( Item 8, Figure 93) extends through the bulkhead grommet ( Item 13, Figure 93) into the engine compartment at least 3 inches (75 mm).

step1.para: Fasten the driver side motor mounting bracket to the cab header with bolts. Tighten to 240 to 265 in-lbs. (27 to 30 Nm).

Position the windshield wiper/washer control panel at the driver side header opening. Reconnect the air lines to the wiper control valves, then reconnect electrical connections to the washer control switch and indicator lights.

note.para: Air line with white tape goes on the fitting nearest the control panel ( Item 7, Figure 92).

step1.para: Position the wiper/washer control panel on the header panel, being sure the air lines do not kink and that the washer control switch and indicator lights connecting wires are not pinched. Install the 6 mounting screws securing the control panel to the header. Tighten to 10 in-lbs. (1.2 Nm).
Install the inner spacer, leather flat washer, outer spacer, hex lock nut, weather seal and serrated drive bushing on the wiper motor shaft.
Install the wiper arm and blade, lockwasher and acorn nut on the wiper motor shaft. Refer to WIPER ARM, Install.
